name: hipster
content:
hipster noun
(FASHIONABLE PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] informal someone who is aware of and influenced by the most recent ideas and fashions: In the past, scooters were ridden mostly by hipsters who considered them cute and fun. The coffee bar's clientele was mostly local professionals, downtown hipsters, and academics.

hipster noun
(CLOTHES)
hipsters [ plural ]
mainly UK (US usually hipster underwear) underwear that fits around or reaches as far as the hips and not up to the waist: Hipsters are a good compromise between low-rise underwear and high-waisted knickers.
UK old-fashioned (US old-fashioned hiphuggers) trousers that fit around or reach as far as the hips and not up to the waist: She was wearing a pair of light blue denim hipsters.
See more
hipster adjective
(FASHIONABLE)
typical of or enjoyed by people who are aware of the most recent ideas and fashions: The town has plenty of galleries, bohemian cafes, and hipster bars these days. I loved the restaurant's cool decor — very hipster but in a nice way.
More examplesFewer examplesThe movie has a great hipster soundtrack.It was US bloggers who helped her find success, after the British media found her too hipster at first.

hipster adjective
(OF CLOTHES)
[ before noun ] (of clothing) fitting around or reaching up as far as the hips and not the waist: Skinny little T-shirts and hipster jeans look terrible on me. The Fifties-style bikinis come in flattering designs, including hipster briefs.
More examplesFewer examplesTailored hipster trousers look elegant worn with a silk shirt.They offer a huge selection of underwear ranging from sporty cotton hipster shorts to sexy lace knickers.The collection featured military details such as epaulets on the shoulders and hipster belts.
